Problem:
Consider a function \\( z(t) \\) described by the complex differential equation \\( z'(t) = iz(t) \\), where \\( i \\) is the imaginary unit. The impact of an integral transformation \\( T[f](s) = \\int_0^\\infty e^{-st} f(t) dt \\) applied to \\( z(t) \\) is considered.

If the initial condition \\( z(0) = 1 \\) is evolved according to the differential equation without further intervention by the transformation T, will \\( T[z](s) \\) be equivalent to the transformation applied initially at \\( t = 0 \\)?
Explanation: Since the differential equation is linear and the transformation T is a linear operator, applying the transformation at any point during the evolution under the differential equation will yield the same result as applying it initially, due to the time-invariance property.
